intro: Ceropegia fimbriata subsp. fimbriata, commonly known as the fimbriate arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and tuberous roots. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or white in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires moderate to bright indirect light. This species is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and unique flowering habit.
